etymologies: early 19th century: from the name of Baron S. von Edelstein Zois (1747–1819), Austrian scholar, + -ite

definitions: a grayish-white or grayish-green crystalline mineral of the epidote group consisting of a hydroxyl silicate of calcium and aluminum.
shortDefinitions: greyish-white or greyish-green crystalline mineral consisting of basic silicate of calcium and aluminium
